result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel A Robles Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time.  Sentence credit for 138 days were granted.
Consecutive to: Count 2 and concurrent to any other sentence.

Straight time.
Consecutive to: Count 1 and concurrent to any other sentence.

DOC document
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Miguel A Robles in court, in custody, with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 and 2 with the repeater struck.  Court finds the defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2, repeater struck.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Redetzke makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1   
Sentence of:
9 months jail consecutive to count #2, concurrent to any other sentence 
138 days credit 
COSTS:  $243.00 WAIVED 

The Court Orders the Following: Count #2   
Sentence of:
90 days jail consecutive to count #1 but concurrent to any other sentence.  
COSTS:  $243.00 WAIVED
$500 signature bond returned Dodge Correctional Inst, Defendant refused to sign signature bond
detainer requested, Dodge Correctional Inst.
from Dodge Correctional Inst.
